intro: Erigeron perennis, commonly known as everlasting blueweed, is a flowering plant native to North America. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant produces small, blue to purple flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. It has hairy, gray-green leaves that are typically opposite along the stems. Erigeron perennis is often found in open, sunny habitats such as meadows and prairies.
